bug.author: Armour
bug.summary: Unexpected error "list index out of range" for empty string
bug.description:
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5276065/42790082-c46e14a0-891d-11e8-8270-1b78e9c1fd0e.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5276065/42790085-c7cefa10-891d-11e8-8705-2f09ba569587.png></denchmark-link>
Maybe should return an empty array, or instead of throwing this error from thinc.neural.op, change to display a developer-friendly message or warning for it? <denchmark-h:h2>How to reproduce the behavior</denchmark-h>
import spacy nlp = spacy.load('en') test_empty_string = nlp('') <denchmark-h:h2>Info about spaCy</denchmark-h>
spaCy version: 2.0.11 Platform: Darwin-17.7.0-x86_64-i386-64bit Python version: 3.6.6 Models: en_core_web_md, en Installed Spacy using Conda

comments.comment: Thanks for the report! And this is strange – I thought we had a test for this. I just ran the code with nightly and the new models (<denchmark-link:https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/releases/tag/v2.1.0a0>see here</denchmark-link> for the release) and it worked fine – so it looks like this will be resolved in the upcoming version
what is the fix for this if we are still using 2.0.11?
I think the easy way is to filter all the empty input before calling it.
This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
